text: Just like her own diabolic form, the Gorequeen’s assemblage of armaments were reforged in Khorne’s realm.
By wearing items that once belonged to the legendary castellan-commander, perhaps their new owner can achieve the same level of infamy?
The twisted, power-hungry commander of the Legion of Azgorh, Drazhoath is the undisputed master of all he surveys.
Despite some extremely stiff competition, the Commander of the Tower of Zharr is one of the cruellest and most power-hungry examples of his fell kind.
The Fay Enchantress is unknowable, and the raiments with which she girds herself are no less mysterious.
Clad in full panoply and mounted on his mechanized assembly, Astragoth combines augmented martial might with potent sorcery
Celestial gifts adorn and protect the Supreme Matriarch...
For some, administration and execution are but two sides of the same coin...
Whether by Celestial gifts or alchemical means, the Western Provinces stand strong.
Tools of power when combined can envelop a witch and her Sisters with a mantle of dark protections...
Malakai Makaisson's formidable engineering skills are only as good as the means to carry them out; fortunately, science and Grungni are on his side!
Equipment befitting of the Countess Emmanuelle's official headsman.
All manner of useful magical artefacts have been stored by Elspeth over the many, many years she has wound her way through this troubled world.
Ingenuity, experimentation and experience... and no small measure of blind luck!
It is by these enchanted means, and of course her own significant martial prowess, that Ulrika defends Kislev from the powers of ultimate darkness.
These icons of filth further empower the Tallyman as he does the Fly Lord's foul bidding.
Only the Urfather's children can truly appreciate His many miraculous blessings and boons.
Snagla Grobspit fashioned these deadly weapons from the remains of the Redvenom tribe's Arachnarok Spider at the behest of the Spider God itself!
The God of the Tides bestows his gifts upon the world, to be wielded by his worthiest champions.
Couronne is the heart of Bretonnian royalty, whose shining heirlooms are the key to its defence.
The burden of murder positively drips from some items, borne more gladly by some than others.
Only by winning these artefacts can the Everchosen prove himself the bearer of each Ruinous Power’s blessing in equal measure.
Beauty and malice so often go hand in hand.
The Sentinels of Nan-Gau are chosen to wield the city's banners.
Chosen by the alchemists of Shang-Yang, the elementalist champions the city and flies its banners.
Myth tells of a champion, blessed with the Dragon Emperor's favour.
The true art of telescopy originates in Grand Cathay.
A curse of blood and death hangs heavy over these artefacts.
As it turns out, saltwater does little to remove bloodstains.
The royal armoury of Naggaroth is home to all manner of malevolent tools and dark enchantments.
Dark Magic weaves only a tapestry of suffering.
Savage, animalistic impulse can only be restrained by the most dark and unforgiving of souls.
Karak Eight Peaks awaits its rightful ruler — one who still bears the symbols of its glory.
Even that which was once lost to legend need not remain lost forever.
Only the greatest living Runelord has the honour of hammering magic into metal upon the famed Anvil of Doom.
The High-King unites all Dawi, wreathed in the glory of the Ancestors.
The Slayer Kings of Karak Kadrin have always defended the Dawi, sworn to meet their doom in glorious battle.
The Imperial Colleges of Magic possess many powerful curiosities, each sizzling with arcane energy.
The heirs of Sigmar lead the Empire through the ages, bearing articles of their Imperial glory.
The Warrior Priests of Sigmar follow the Grand Theogonist to battle, rallying around the sigil of the Griffon.
Waaagh! Magic and 'ard metal — makes all the puny gits nice and dead!
Everyfing's covered in blood, but da axe and da armour could use some more red…
They's good fer killin', and that's all ya need ta know.
There's Waaagh! energy in these; da Prophet can hear its whispers.
Gems adorn the Everqueen, as powerful and radiant as the ritual consort herself.
There is light to be found, even in the darkest of shadows.
The rightful belongings of the Warden of Tor Yvresse have long been passed down through generations.
With armour and lance at the ready, the last Dragon Prince is sworn to defend the kingdom of Caledor.
As a Sorcerer of unmatched power, the Warden of the White Tower wields blade and magic in unison.
The heir of Aenarion has inherited many gifts, not least the worldly goods of his illustrious forefather.
War and blood, and the trappings needed to collect them.
A title for the Kislevite noble dedicated to the Ice Court.
The Tzarina's royal articles – worn for ceremonial duties and for war.
Boris returns, and so he will need his cloak and blade once more.
One that is kin with the bears of Kislev.
More than bears roam the icy oblasts... Legends still tell of the Great Wyrms.
The Old Ones exert their influence through powerful relics, in accordance with the Great Plan.
Some artefacts are imbued with the ancient energy of the Old Ones… as are some of their champions.
The Solar-City is home to many relics and curiosities, each of great use in battle.
When wandering the jungles of Lustria, one is bound to discover a variety of interesting baubles.
As a fearsome God of War, Sotek devours the enemies of Lustria in the form of a mighty serpent.
The skies above Lustria are home to a number of ferocious beasts — the Cold Ones make use of them all.
The plague doctors of Nurgle need their tools.
It takes more than guts… it takes balls.
Da shiniest of sceptres and pimpiest crown, only the Overtyrant can wear 'em.
Halflin' meat is like da most tender, just make sure it doesn't get stuck in da teef.
It ain't just da Blood God dat likes a skull or two, or six.
Those that wield the Blood Cleaver will mark upon themselves the tally of Daemon kills. Only a great tally will sate the Maw.
A pirates treasures are not all silver and gold.
An assassin is only as good as his tools, and few are so deadly as these.
Every creation fashioned by the Chief Warlock-Engineer is a marvel of science and sorcery.
All fear the Plaguelords of Clan Pestilens, whose Dark Magic spreads naught but sickness and decay.
Together, this weapon and armour has become a symbol of both fear and hate among the Dwarfen throngs.
Broken minds and broken bodies — there is much to be learned from both.
Ecstasy and despair – all are one.
The sands of Nehekhara yield only to its king, who rules in death as he did in life.
Such myriad items that pulse and flux: the tools of Change.
The veil between life and death is a fragile thing; with the right tools, one might easily break through.
In Sylvania, magic and blood are weaved together as one.
If Undeath is considered a curse, blood is the only thing that can lift it, albeit only temporarily.
The spirit of the forest remains ever untamed, living eternally in bounteous gifts of nature.
Even to the most skilled marksman, the woods can be ally or enemy alike.
